input_text:
Job Title: Senior Software Engineer

Location: Carlsbad, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
About Us

One team. Global challenges. Infinite opportunities. At Viasat, we’re on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. For more than 35 years, Viasat has helped shape how consumers, businesses, governments and militaries around the globe communicate. We’re looking for people who think big, act fearlessly, and create an inclusive environment that drives positive impact to join our team.

What You'll Do

This team is focused on providing airline employees as well as the end users with the best in-flight connectivity service. In this position you will be an integral part of the DevOps Commercial Mobility team and make meaningful impacts to the in-flight connectivity service for commercial airline flights that take place every day.

Your responsibilities will range from developing software that is able to scale across multiple commercial airline fleets to creating new products and services to monitoring and maintaining existing services for the commercial airline passenger, flight crew, mechanics, and installers.

The day-to-day

Our team aims to develop a common, stable, and secure platform for venue-side applications and services across all verticals within GEM. We achieve this by building and managing an Operating Environment (OE) that encompasses the Operating System and essential host services. In this role, you will:

Be recognized as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in a technical areaRoutinely influence design decisions and resolves issues to align to business needsWork on and lead project of diverse scope with little instructionContribute to architecture decisions and integrations that impact multiple productsDevelop and deliver technical briefingsTypically works with others to define the problem to be solved/feature to be designed, and then works autonomously with little instruction on day-to-day workDemonstrate judgement to obtain relevant and timely results and metrics using appropriate methods and toolsRecommend or be involved in evaluating new methodology and influencing its adoptionMay mentor junior team membersLead technical design reviews and is effective at communicating technical ideasHelp project leaders make informed decisions by providing technical inputHelp teams adhere to and adopt industry best practicesWork across multiple teams/groups contributing to technical decisionsMay expand skillsets by becoming knowledgeable in new areasIdentify opportunities to improve product performance, cost, reliability and securityContribute and participate in design, product implementation, test, production, and operations reviews


What You'll Need

Typically requires 10+ years of related experience with commercial software development in building distributed applications and with a Master's degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering; or 12+ years related experience with a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering; or 14+ years related experience without relevant degreeExperience with Linux systems programming and embedded developmentExperience with programming languages/frameworks: C/C++, Python, Shell Scripting and/or JavaExperience with development tools: Linux, Amazon Web Services, Git, Artifactory, Jenkins, Ansible, Kubernetes, DockerFamiliarity with networking: UDP, TCP/IP, AMQP, DHCP, DNS, and/or REST 


What Will Help You On The Job

Experience with cloud technology, automation, machine learning, big data, and/or Front-end developmentExperience with programming languages/frameworks: Golang, NodeJS, Angular, and/or React


Salary range

$168,100.00 - $292,200.00 / annually

At Viasat, we consider many factors when it comes to compensation, including the scope of the position as well as your background and experience. Base pay may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Additional cash or stock incentives may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. Learn more about Viasat’s comprehensive benefit offerings that are focused on your holistic health and wellness at careers.viasat.com/LifeAtViasat/Benefits.

EEO statement

Viasat is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, genetics, age, or veteran status or any other applicable legally protected status or characteristic. If you would like to request an accommodation on the basis of disability for completing this on-line application, please click here.

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Senior Software Engineer
output_json.summary: Join Viasat, a global leader in connectivity solutions, as a Senior Software Engineer focusing on airline in-flight connectivity services.
preferred_degrees: Master's degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering
job_responsibilities: Develop scalable software for commercial airline fleets
Lead project and technical design reviews
Provide technical input for informed decision-making
Improve product performance, cost, reliability, and security
Participate in design, implementation, testing, production, and operations reviews
output_json.company_information: Viasat is a global leader in connectivity solutions, offering advanced satellite and terrestrially-based communications technologies.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: Viasat is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, genetics, age, or veteran status or any other applicable legally protected status or characteristic.
